column4: Anyone know how I can make sure I'm using an apt repository right?
comment out all but the PPA repo that you want in your source list.
Found http://ppa.launchpad.net lucid/main Packages
Found http://ppa.launchpad.net lucid Packages
I also got: Ign http://ppa.launchpad.net/team-xbmc/ppa/ubuntu/ lucid/main Translation-nb
ad the one you want, comment out those your dont, add the Auth Key's as stated earlier.
I've done that.. And the add-apt-repository already added the auto key's
Here's a simple How-To for repos: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Repositories/CommandLine
I know that stuff about repos.. Here i've done the exact same thing on both my ubuntu desktop 64bit systems: http://pastebin.com/7zkRLKCG
kinda strange that it says: #
still diffrent result.
what do you mean, diffrent results, what is tha ACTUALLY FAULT OR PROBLEM UR TRYING TO SOLVE THEN ?
I'm trying to reinstall the xbmc packages.. since I had an svn apt mirror.. I want to install the packages from the stable mirror
means.. "downgrading" a package version.
from 1:10.08~svn32246-lucid1 to 1:9.11-lucid2
if thats possible..
I must say, Im not the best expert on downgrading, but will have a nose around and see what I can find.
This did it :-): apt-get --reinstall install xbmc=1:9.11-lucid2 xbmc-bin=1:9.11-lucid2 xbmc-data=1:9.11-lucid2 xbmc-skin-confluence=1:9.11-lucid2
what was the result ?
obs.. seems like an install error.. I'll try to --purge the package and install it.
worked.. after I did apt-get remove --purge
thansk for the help tho.. to clearify the problem.
you should write upa "How-Too" for others wanting to do the same things.
